item.title: Ticket #1766 (Grammar correction in admin error text) created
item.dc:creator: h3h
item.description:
"If this file was writable you could edit it." should be "If this file were writable you could edit it." It's a hypothetical, not past tense.

Attaching patch.

item.title: Ticket #1765 (Simplify and standardize anchor syntax) created
item.dc:creator: h3h
item.description:
n a semi-recent changeset [2906], there are anchors that are being created on the admin post page. I've also seen more recent patches with the same. The HTML uses the following syntax:

<a id="preview-post"></a>

I am wondering why this specific syntax is being used instead of simply adding the same id to the h2 element itself, like so:

<h2 id="preview-post"><?php _e('Post Preview (updated when post is saved)'); ?> ...

As far as I know, using the A element for anchoring is a thing of the past, and even then it was <a name="..."> (an empty element without the closing </a>).

Clarification on this usage would be appreciated and I think it would be good to establish a product-wide standard for anchor syntax (if one doesn't already exist).

item.title: Ticket #1764 (Add Preview link to Edit Page form) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith

item.title: Ticket #1764 (Add Preview link to Edit Page form) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith

item.title: Ticket #1764 (Add Preview link to Edit Page form) created
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description: the Edit Page form has a preview, but lacks the "preview" link at the top of the page. This patch gives it the link (and the matching anchor so that the "edit" link works).

item.title: Ticket #1763 (Link visibility radiobuttons belong to two different classes) updated
item.dc:creator: seth
item.description:
Index: edit-link-form.php
===================================================================
--- edit-link-form.php  (revision 2951)
+++ edit-link-form.php  (working copy)
@@ -216,7 +216,7 @@
            <td><label>
              <input type="radio" name="link_visible" <?php if ($link->link_visible == 'Y') echo "checked='checked'"; ?> value="Y" />
 <?php _e('Yes') ?></label><br /><label>
-<input type="radio" name="visible" <?php if ($link->link_visible == 'N') echo "checked='checked'"; ?> value="N" />
+<input type="radio" name="link_visible" <?php if ($link->link_visible == 'N') echo "checked='checked'"; ?> value="N" />
 <?php _e('No') ?></label></td>
          </tr>
 </table>

item.title: Ticket #1763 (Link visibility radiobuttons belong to two different classes) created
item.dc:creator: seth
item.description:
{{{ <td><label>

<input type="radio" name="link_visible" value="Y" />

Yes</label><br /><label> <input type="radio" name="visible" checked='checked' value="N" /> No</label></td> }}} This is on the Edit Link page, at the bottom. You can't set a link to visible because the names are incompatible.

item.title: Ticket #1749 (Global Variables are not available in Plugin functions) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description: try setting global $wp_query; and using $wp_query->query_varshour?, $wp_query->query_varsday?, etc...

item.title: Ticket #1762 (permalinks structure not i18n friendly) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description: should this be customizable via an options interface or via plugins or via i18n? I can think of even English-speakers who would want to change this, like /author/ => /artist/ or /contributer/ or something else, so maybe these should be options on the permalink options page.
